column1: Cognitive Behaviour Therapy and Counselling - MSc
column3: School of Social Sciences and Humanities
column5: The MSc programme in Cognitive Behavioural Therapy and Counselling is an advanced professional and clinical training for students who wish to practice as psychotherapists offering cognitive behaviour therapy and psychodynamic therapy.Having this dual track approach to understanding mental health widens opportunities to work in a wide range of mental health settings, both statutory, voluntary and private. The course enables the capacity to work from different theoretical approaches to understanding both research and its application to clinical theory and practice.
column7: UK part-time tuition fee: £972 per 20 credits (please contact the Student Life Centre for further information).
